Edward William "Bob" Barker was born on December 12, 1923, in Darrington, Washington, to a family of farmers. He grew up in a small town in California and developed a passion for radio broadcasting at an early age.

After serving in the United States Navy during World War II, Barker began his broadcasting career in 1948, hosting various radio shows and working his way up to television. He became a familiar face on American television, hosting the popular game show "Truth or Consequences" from 1956 to 1974.

In 1972, Barker took over as host of "The Price Is Right," a position he held for an unprecedented 35 years, from September 4, 1972, to June 15, 2007. During his tenure, the show became a beloved staple of American television, with Barker's charismatic personality, witty banter, and iconic catchphrases ("Come on down!", "Have your pets spayed or neutered!", and "Goodbye, everybody!") making him a household name.

Throughout his career, Barker won numerous awards, including multiple Emmy Awards, and was inducted into the Television Hall of Fame in 2004. He was also a vocal advocate for animal rights, frequently using his platform to promote animal welfare and support various animal-related charities.

After retiring from "The Price Is Right," Barker remained active in the entertainment industry, making appearances on various TV shows and hosting the PBS game show "Dolphin Treasure" from 2011 to 2013. He passed away on June 12, 2023, at the age of 99, leaving behind a legacy as one of the most beloved and iconic game show hosts in American television history.
